Sentencas: Electrochemical Impedance Spectroscopy (EIS) is a frequently used method to characterize electrodes for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells (SOFC) or Electrolyzer Cells (SOEC).
Titulo: Use of a distribution function of relaxation times (DFRT) in impedance analysis of SOFC electrodes

Sentencas: The porous microstructures, use of composite structures and sometimes extra functional layers in an electrode, result often in impedance spectra that are difficult to analyze.
Titulo: Use of a distribution function of relaxation times (DFRT) in impedance analysis of SOFC electrodes

Sentencas: Transformation of the impedance into a distribution function of relaxation times (DFRT) is about to become a new standard in EIS analysis.
Titulo: Use of a distribution function of relaxation times (DFRT) in impedance analysis of SOFC electrodes

Sentencas: This inversion to the tau-domain requires solving a Fredholm integral of the second kind, which is known as an 'ill-posed inverse problem'.
Titulo: Use of a distribution function of relaxation times (DFRT) in impedance analysis of SOFC electrodes

Sentencas: Hence the resulting DFRT's should not be trusted directly.
Titulo: Use of a distribution function of relaxation times (DFRT) in impedance analysis of SOFC electrodes

Sentencas: In cases were impedance data can be modelled satisfactory with an Equivalent Circuit (EqC), built of known dispersion relations (e.g. (RQ), Gerischer, Finite Length Warburg) an analytic distribution function, G(tau), can be constructed.
Titulo: Use of a distribution function of relaxation times (DFRT) in impedance analysis of SOFC electrodes

Sentencas: This can be compared with the inversion results obtained from Fourier Transform (FT), Tikhonov Regularization (TR) and multi-(RQ) CNLS fits (m(RQ)fit), thus allowing evaluation and validation of these methods This is illustrated in this contribution with four examples of SOFC cathodes with quite different properties.
Titulo: Use of a distribution function of relaxation times (DFRT) in impedance analysis of SOFC electrodes

Sentencas: The results apply equally well to SOFC anodes (or SOEC cathodes).
Titulo: Use of a distribution function of relaxation times (DFRT) in impedance analysis of SOFC electrodes
